cppcoreguidelines-misleading-capture-def.description:
Description

Warns when lambda specify a by-value capture default and capture
this
.

By-value capture defaults in member functions can be misleading about whether
data members are captured by value or reference. This occurs because specifying
the capture default
[=]
actually captures the
this
pointer by value,
not the data members themselves. As a result, data members are still indirectly
accessed via the captured
this
pointer, which essentially means they are
being accessed by reference. Therefore, even when using
[=]
, data members
are effectively captured by reference, which might not align with the userâ€™s
expectations.

Examples:

struct
AClass
{
int
member
;
void
misleadingLogic
()
{
int
local
=
0
;
member
=
0
;
auto
f
=
[
=
]()
mutable
{
local
+=
1
;
member
+=
1
;
};
f
();
// Here, local is 0 but member is 1
}
void
clearLogic
()
{
int
local
=
0
;
member
=
0
;
auto
f
=
[
this
,
local
]()
mutable
{
local
+=
1
;
member
+=
1
;
};
f
();
// Here, local is 0 but member is 1
}
};

This check implements
F.54
from the C++ Core Guidelines.
